channel.title: What is cryption.JAVA for?
channel.description:
What is it for? What does it do? When does it be used? What purpose is it for? Why does it have to be used? How does it be used? Can I delete it?
Answer these questions please. Or some of them.

item.title: What is cryption.JAVA for?
item.dc:creator: @televator0 televator0
item.description:
@televator0 wrote:

ok dont do anything to it, thats pretty much awnsers everything, its like something to do with the logging in and out process.

Read full topic

item.title: What is cryption.JAVA for?
item.dc:creator: @llamamastafu llamamastafu
item.description:
@llamamastafu wrote:

// login response - 0 means exchange session key to establish encryption

just search your client.java youâ€™ll find that it deals with logging in so i dont advise deleting it

also found this:

			// don't bother reading the RSA encrypted block because we can't unless
			// we brute force jagex' private key pair or employ a hacked client the removes
			// the RSA encryption part or just uses our own key pair.
			// Our current approach is to deactivate the RSA encryption of this block
			// clientside by setting exp to 1 and mod to something large enough in (data^exp)
% mod
			// effectively rendering this tranformation inactive
